programme.title: Slideshow Saturdays - Human Footprints
programme.desc: Our human footprint from space, photographed by astronauts on the International Space Station. Duration: 225

programme.title: Sound of the Earth
programme.desc: For more than three decades, Grammy and Emmy nominated guitarist, composer, producer David Becker has continued to define himself as one of the best and most unique voices in jazz and contemporary music by combining diverse influences and a passion for the new and different, and his ability to play for the present while always keeping an eye on the past and future. He has led the critically acclaimed DAVID BECKER TRIBUNE to a worldwide audience by performing in more than 35 countries. Duration: 165

programme.title: David Becker - Truth Lies Within
programme.desc: Jazz Guitarist David Becker captures the ultimate Universal duality that's hard to ignore. In Partnership with Space Channel Music, David's melodious guitar takes us on a journey through space and time to discover the truth in all things, and our connection and rhythm with the Cosmos Duration: 500

programme.title: Sounds of Star Wars
programme.desc: The audience (and Droid) favorite from a galaxy far, far away – featuring guest soloist Tanya Gabrielian Duration: 150

programme.title: Mission - Above Area 51
programme.desc: Stunning images of the most secretive military base in America. Duration: 73

programme.title: Slideshow Saturdays - Mountains of Earth
programme.desc: The mountains of Earth, seen from Space. Duration: 210

programme.title: SpinLaunch
programme.desc: American spaceflight technology development company, SpinLaunch, has signed a Space Act Agreement with NASA. Space Act Agreements are made possible by the National Aeronautics and Space Act of 1958 that empowers NASA to fund a domestic partner, such as a private company or a university, to accomplish an NASA agency mission. Duration: 171

programme.title: StellarVue Telescopes
programme.desc: Stellarvue is more than just a telescope company. Since 1998, Stellarvue has fostered a global community (a '"Stellar-family") of employees and customers who are passionate about astronomy, education, and viewing the night sky through high-quality telescopes. Today, Stellarvue continues to use innovative technology to produce high-quality optics that provide exceptionally clear, sharp views of celestial objects. Duration: 431

programme.title: ISS Then and Now
programme.desc: A brief history of the ISS, from the first module to the future of Space Stations Duration: 150

programme.title: SpaceX update 5-16-22
programme.desc: According to SPACEX President and CEO Gwynne Shotwell in a CNBC interview, we’ll put people on Mars within the decade. She goes on to say that getting a large delivery to the surface will get people to start thinking about Mars as a real place to go. Duration: 145

programme.title: Space Channel Movie : The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: An Alien lands in Washington D.C. and has a warning for all mankind. He tells the people of Earth that they must live peacefully or be destroyed as a danger to other planets. Duration: 7200

programme.title: Space Channel Movies: Without Warning
programme.desc: Sandy and Greg are teenagers who go camping, despite warnings not to, with their friends. They soon encounter aliens, who are using the area as a hunting ground. Duration: 7200

programme.title: UFO Congress update
programme.desc: The Pentagon has showcased declassified UFO-related videos and photos to Congress that included footage of a small object zipping past a military pilot as well as glowing triangles in the night sky. Duration: 175

programme.title: Helen Ramirez - On the Border of a New Frontier
programme.desc: Space Channel Crews caught up with Helen Ramirez (Brownsville’s Deputy City Manager) to discuss her efforts to build a wholistic space ecosystem in the Rio Grande Valley. From rockets to investment and communications, the City of Brownsville is leading the way as Texas becomes the epicenter for America’s new space economy. Duration: 277

programme.title: Silicon Valley of Space
programme.desc: The Silicon Valley of Space, quietly building a Gateway to Mars on the Texas/Mexico border. Duration: 150

programme.title: Trash Bags in Space
programme.desc: Nanarocks has developed an innovative way to manage waste in space, with an idea everyone on Earth can relate to Duration: 292

programme.title: Health Report - NASA Food Upgrade
programme.desc: In coordination with the Canadian Space Agency, NASA is asking the public to help create sustainable food production technology that can be done with few resources and minimal waste. Duration: 180

programme.title: NEWS | Starship and Polaris Program Update
programme.desc: Elon announced the Starship program may move to Cape Canaveral, and Jared Isaacman in tandem with SpaceX announced a new mission series named the Polaris Program. Duration: 350

programme.title: Latest News - Red Moon Rising
programme.desc: In 2021, it achieved an average of more than one launch per week for the first time in its orbital spaceflight history, making it the busiest year for its space program to date. We watched the country pass many milestones from successfully landing its first rover on Mars and test flying a hypersonic spaceplane to building the core module for its Tiangong space station and launching the first taikonauts onto the said module. Duration: 376

programme.title: This Obi Wan-Cannot-Be!
programme.desc: Our team Ewoks the line with a deep space dive to a social galaxy, far far away Duration: 387

programme.title: Darth Tater
programme.desc: In this exclusive episode of "Sith Figures," young Darth Tater trains with a Masher Jedi...until the fight goes gravy wrong. Duration: 215

programme.title: Space Channel Academy
programme.desc: Civilization ending event, or wild conspiracy? We break it down. Duration: 290

programme.title: Latest News - Tide in Space
programme.desc: SpaceX sent Tide detergent to astronauts on the ISS so they can figure out how to do laundry for long-haul trips to Mars. Astronauts on the ISS received a shipment of items onboard a SpaceX spacecraft on Wednesday. The shipment included specially-developed laundry detergent made by Tide. Duration: 224

programme.desc: In coordination with the Canadian Space Agency, NASA is asking the public to help create sustainable food production technology that can be done with few resources and minimal waste. Duration: 194

programme.title: Latest News - Virgin Galactic China update
programme.desc: So you wanna go to space? Well, now's your chance. Although you may be waiting awhile. Virgin Galactic has just opened ticket sales to the public for flights to the edge of space. Meanwhile, China's Chang'e 5 lunar sample return mission is now in an interesting lunar orbit. Duration: 200
